values:
I hate my lj.

I made a new one. (again...)

vegan_love
We Forgot "Here is Gone" By the Goo Goo Dolls! o.O;;;

I feel like writing.... or having sex... either one.... Maybe I'll stick with writing though. lol.

I wish I had someone I could talk to. It makes me mad that I don't. I want someone who will just sit there and listen. Someone who knows the world better than I do. Someone who's don't going to make mean comments about people I care about. Someone who's not going to yell at me for the things I've done, but instead share stories of similar experiences.

I miss you Kristine *whines*

I could talk to you about anything. But now, I can't even say Hi. *sigh*

I feel compelled to completely open up to someone and just, cry on their shoulder. Don't tell me that you're here for me because most of the people on my friends list have proven at one point or another that they can't help me. And I have serious problems with crying in front of people anyway.
Only, 3 of my friends have ever seen me cry. (Kristine. Gavin. Jon.) There have been occasions when I've cried while on the phone with Miles and Shao, but that's different....

I miss long conversations about things that truly matter. *sigh* I wish, that I could have a boyfriend I could talk to like that...
Let it be known that my first born son shall be named Shaolin.

I feel the need to write a lot of pointless rants. I apologize to the few people who actually read my lj.

((Have you ever noticed you can't say "a l.j." when your talking? It sounds better to say "an lj" Why is that?))

Anyway....


Sean... I wish I knew whatever became of him... He was my first boyfriend. I adored him. I never actually even touched him. We just, wrote letters to eachother. ha ha. Our relationship lasted about a week. Then he moved to Old Orchard. Sean was an amazing person. For being in 5th/6th grade he was so much more mature than most of the 18 year old I know now. I would have like to stay with him. I wonder what would have happened with our relationship...


I was talking to Eric Overlock last night. About nothing really of intrest. But I had said my usual "The world hates me" and he sweetly replied that he didn't hate me. So it got me to thinking about the relationship we had in 6th grade. That time on the bus when we first met and he asked me out like, a million times. >.<;; I kept saying no. But the f***er was persistant as h*ll and a few days later Michelle and Linsey asked him out for me and we started dating. Eric was actually a pretty good boyfriend. We dated during Valentine's day and he bought me flowers and a stuffed dog. ha ha. It was sweet. I actually still have the dog somewhere around here. He'd follow me around the playground like a lost puppy. I ended up breaking up with him. I was in 6th grade. Relationships scared me. I wanted nothing to do with them other than the aspect of just saying that I had a boyfriend. Everything was a game then, nothing had meaning. But I dunno. I was an as*hole to him anyway. I don't know why he would even still want to talk to me.


Alex is still my buddy, always will be. But, I dunno. At the time I didn't want the long distance relationship. I didn't like phone calls. I was still, kinda scared of relationships. I think it works out better with the two of us just being friends.


I love Miles. I truley adore him. We managed to make a long distance relationship work, and work well. We had a lot of stupid problems, a lot of arguments. But, I really did love our relationship.


Then along comes Jon. I don't know... It was like, from the moment I saw him, I wanted to be with him. He gave me a hug at rock-n-bowl at Gavin's birthday. It was almost like, I belonged with him. I felt safe around him. So I convinced Miles that he wanted to break up with me the following thursday. And then I went to rock-n-bowl the next day (just to see Jon). I found out he lived pretty close to me, and so Anita and I walked over there the next day. Jon was on house arrest then, so we spent a lot of time together. We started dating that Sunday. Everyday was perfect. I got to spend forever in his arms. I remember one day, we were hanging around in my kitchen, I was sitting on his lap, and I told him that I wanted the world to end at that moment, so that I could die happy. But the whole relationship, Jon lied, and he cheated. He left me for Clara. He got mad over stupid things. We never talked about anything because he "didn't talk to people". That's why I like that we're not dating now. I can't get hurt if we're not dating. It kills me that he can get me to do almost anything. I hate that when I see him, no matter how mad I am, I just.... melt... and I end up using the dreaded "L" word. I miss our perfect relationship, even if it was only perfect in my mind. I miss spending hours laying on the couch together. I miss that terribly.



2 min. till the bell rings. I'm done with my stupid rants.
Out of curiosity, does anyone know anything about the whereabouts of Sean Smith?
New Icon. I rather like it.

I made vegan chocolate chip cookies. They turned out so well. ^_^ It makes me sad that I can't have milk with um. I'm not too fond of soymilk, so I don't want that. *sigh* I suppose water will do.

But yeah. Vegan Cookies = <3

It also makes me want to bake more often. I used to bake all the time, but not so much anymore due to extreme.....laziness...... >.o;; Maybe I should start cooking again.

Meh Dad called today.... had an intresting conversation......... enough said. You want to know more, you can come talk to me.

I hate myself right now for so many reasons.

My lack of self disciplin for one.

My lack of common sense.

My lack of courage.

My shyness.

I hate it all.

I have become obsessed with the murder case of Lizzie Borden's parents.

<-- Andrew Borden (Lizzie's Father)'s skull. ha ha.
Lizzie Borden took an axe
And gave her mother forty whacks.
And when she saw what she had done
She gave her father forty-one.
She's absolutly brilliant. In a very evil morbid way, but, I mean, she got away with the murder of her step-mother and father. There arn't too many people who can pull that off.

There was TONS of evidence against her, and she just.... I don't know.... she's just brilliant. Although she did get disowned by her entire town and was forced to move.

<strike>
You chose the life you wanted.

That life isn't with me.

I'm going to pretend that I'm not falling apart.

I'm going to pretend that I don't need you.

I'm going to do my best to forget you.

I'm going to delete your pictures from my camera.

I'll chant in my head:
"I don't love you, I don't want you, I don't miss you"
until the words make sense.

I'm not going to cry.

I'm going to act like I'm alright.

Goodbye, Jon.
</strike>
::---- Always::
-Hannah-

The miss susie one always amused me. I remeber the girls singing that in the back of the bus when I was in grade school. I never did take the time to learn it though. It kinda upsets me now. I feel like I missed out on a part of childhood.

Today=Blah

Clint, freaking out 'cause I'm taking his picture.
Heidi and I were doing the math problems on the board 'cause we hate doing them on paper, lol.

I really hate when people refer to Jon and I as "fuckbuddies" we are nothing of the sort and people need to stay out of my business anyway. What I choose to do is my business and my business alone. I love Jon. That's all you need to know.

I will snap on anyone who comments with something stupid. As I have not had my medication for 2 days now.

Shao is the only one with a right to yell at me, or to judge me, as he is my father.

You other people, are just that, people, when I move, most of you will be forgotten, that is the sad truth. I will not make any attempt to stay in contact with most of you, because, when I move I plan on starting over, and getting my life back on track. And all you people do if judge my every action, and I'm so fucking sick of it.

And yesterday, I just about killed me not to fight back. I'm like, chanting in my head "you're vegan, you're ------, you're a passifist, you can't fight". I ended up accidently clawing her arm, which I apologized for.

((MTV commercials suck))

((Gwen Stenani sucks too))

I love this. My favorites, or the ones that are true for me (when I lived in Maine) are in Red.

You Know You're From Maine When:
You've had arguments over the comparative quality of Fried Dough.

You call four inches of snow "a dusting."

You don't understand why there aren't fried clam shacks elsewhere in the county.

You know what an Irving is and the location of 15 of them.

You knew all the flavors at Perry's Nut House.

Your car is covered in yellow-green dust in May.

You can drive the Augusta traffic circle without slowing down.

You've hung out at a gravel pit.

You think a mosquito could be a species of bird.

You once skipped school and went to Bar Harbor, Old Orchard Beach or Reid State Park.

Even your school cafeteria made good chowder.

You've almost fallen asleep driving between Houlton and Presque Isle.

You know how to pronounce Calais.

You've made a meal out of a Jordan's red dye hot-dog, a bag of Humpty Dumpty potato chips and a can of soda.

You've gone to a Grange bean supper.

In high school, you (or a friend) packed Deering Ice Cream cones.

At least once in your life, a seagull pooped on your head.

At least once in your life you've said, "It smells like the mill in here."

There's a fruit and vegetable stand within 10 minutes of your house.

You crave Italian sandwiches at least weekly.

Your house converts to a B&B every July and August for people from away that you happen to know.

All year long you're tracking sand in the house-from the beach in the summer and the roads and sidewalks in the winter.

You have to have the sand cleaned out of your brake system every spring.

You do the majority of your shopping out of Uncle Henry's.

You've ditched the car on the side of the road somewhere because you thought you saw some good fiddleheads!

You know a lobster pot is a trap, not a kettle.

You know not to plant tender crops until the last full moon in May.

You go to the dump and bring back more than you brought.

You've watched "Murder she Wrote" and snickered at the stupid fake accents.

You know how to find the rope swing at the quarry.

You take the New Hampshire toll personally.

You always wave when you see a Maine license plate in another state.

When you're supposed to dress up, you wear flannel with a tie.

There's too much "stuff" in your 2 "cah" garage to get either of your cars into it.

You know what a frappe is.

L.L. Bean's not just a store, it's a way of life.

"The City" means exclusively Portland.

"Salt damage" is a viable insurance claim.

All of the traffic lights blink yellow at 10 o'clock at night.

It's not a storm - it's a Nor'eastah.

"Open 24/7" might as well be Greek.

More stores have "Bienvenue" flags than "Welcome" flags.

You eat ice cream with flavors like 'Moose Tracks" and "Maine Black Bear".

You know that a chocolate doughnut is not a white doughnut with chocolate frosting.

You wouldn't eat beans in tomato sauce or Manhattan clam chowder if you were starving!

As a child, you played outside in a snow storm without hat, mittens, scarf and with your jacket open because it was just a little cool.

The area around your back door is referred to as "the dooryard".

You eat potato chips with flavors such as "clam dip", "ketchup" and "dill pickle".

You call the basement "downcellah."

There is only one shopping plaza in town.

You use "wicked" as a multipurpose part of speech

Your pickup has more mud on it then the ground around it for a 15 foot radius.

More than 1/2 the meat in your freezer is moose.

You enjoy a hot chocolate more than a margarita.

If your "luxury vehicle" is a twelve-year-old rustbucket on wheels.

If your dog eats better than you do, and more often too.

If you never say what you paid for an item but how much you "give" for it.

You actually get these jokes and pass them on to other friends from Maine.
http://www.blogthings.com/wherefrom.html
You promised me forever.... so why are you gone?

Here is a list of lovely concerts I will, sadly, not be attending.

Rasputina is playing in Chicago tonight. Guess who can't get a ride to Chicago. >.<

Green Day is playing on the 10th, and of course, it's already sold out.

Coldplay is playing in Chicago Friday. Tickets are only $300 each. >.<

Eminem is playing in July. Tickets are $200 at the cheapest, $2,500 at most.

NIN is playing in Chicago on Friday. Tickets are $175.

Modest Mouse is playing in Wisconsin on June 6th. Only 8 tickets left, selling for $95 each.

The Killers are playing in Wisconsin on May 7th. Tickets are $90 each.

The Mars Volta (I don't like them, but I know a lot of people who do) are playing in Chicago on the 16th, tickets are $95 each.

Oasis is playing in Chicago June 20th. Tickets are $90 each.




*sigh* I want to see Coldplay, NIN, and Eminem.

If anyone wants to buy me some tickets or give me a ride to chicago tonight, I'll love you forever ^_^;

ha ha. Gavin and I were looking at icons for lj. One of them had a picture of those jelly bracelets and it said "they're just bracelets you perverts". rather confused, I asked Gavin what that meant. He explained it to me and of course, we walked to Walmart so I could buy some ^_^ lol.

For any stupid people: You wear them and then if someone breaks it off you have to do whatever the color of the bracelet signifies.

I don't have many colors. I bought, like, every color I could find.
I have blue (blow job)
green (outdoor sex)
pink (flashing)
gold (make out)
orange (kiss)

I had some purple ones (anal sex) but I gave them all to Gavin, lol. And Gavin gave me one of his black ones (sex) but it broke as he was taking it off his wrist, so we're going to super glue it and pretend it didn't break, lol.

I want some red ones (make out) and more orange ones.

I don't know if I'd actually go along with any of this, it just amuses me. *shrug* There are a bunch of people who just wear them for the hell of it.

The whole thing is rather stupid. I just like the bracelets. *shrug*

::Love Always::
-Hannah-

Ha ha. My mom and I are actually getting along today. Jon and I are getting alone. Gavin and I are getting along. I'm in such a good mood ^_^ My system is starting to stablize out and the B12 is really starting to take effect. It makes me happy. I feel like I'm not crazy anymore. ^_^

My mom and I were talking and she was telling me about this lady who came into the petshop she works at. The lady (about 18 years old) walks over to the hamster cages, asks what the cheapest one is, my mom shows her and then the lady says "okay, I'll take that one, because my husband has a snake and he told me to get something to feed it"
My Mom: ...no. You're not feeding the hamsters to a snake.
Lady: oh, no, no, no, I'm getting the hamster for...my daughter...
My mom: *cough*bullshit*cough*
Lady: I want to get that hamster for my daughter.
My mom: no.
Lady: what?
My Mom: no.
Lady: ....why?
My Mom: I don't believe you.
Lady: But... I want that hamster...
My mom: no.
Lady: Can I see your boss?
My mom: no.
Lady: Fine, then I'll just leave.
My mom: okay.
*lady leaves*

That right there is brilliant.

Then we joked about Emma ratting me out when I snuck out. And about how close she was to calling the cops. Then we talked about Jon and I. And why Jon never comes over anymore. We talked about Chicago, the schools there. We talked about Maine. We talked about my older brother being on tv. We talked about the writing on my hand saying "Love is suicide" and the artist meaning of it.

"Art is not to question.
It's do or die.
That's why it's artistic suicide." (or something like that.)

My mom can be pretty cool sometimes.

*smiles* yeah, good day.

I refused to sit in a desk for most of my classes. And I refused to wear shoes too. I spent all math class painting about love.









::Love Always::
-Hannah-
